Description: Cornelian rectangular plaque decorated on one side with a representation of Amenhotep II seated before a horse and inscribed with the same king's prenomen, longitudinally pierced, the other side decorated with a representation of Amenhotep II hunting an ibex with a bow and inscribed with the same prenomen.
Exhibition history: 2021-2022 16 Sept-9 Jan, Budapest, Museum of Fine Arts, The discovery of the Pharaoh's tomb, Amenhotep II and his time
